sudo apt-get install build-essential will install gcc, as well as many other things, as many have told you to do, in that case
/usr/bin is NOT "property of the user, only /usr/local/bin, /usr/bin is "owned" by the package manager
ls /usr/local/, you'll find /usr/local/bin/ under there, but all the directories there are fair game for you
